page.title: 09FARMING DARTMOOR
page.content: This is the main occupation of the area. The value of farmland varies from Â£100 an acre for rough moorland to about Â£1300 an acre for better grazing land. Just recently a field sold for Â£1700 an acre. After Mr.William Whitley died intestate in 1957 tenant farms on the{Buckland {Estate}were sold to the tenants, there fore these farms are now all freehold. In 1957 the 6 farms were sold for Â£60,000. In July 1985 one of these farms was sold for Â£150,000. In 1957 the 17th.Century thatched Bridge Cottages sold for about Â£1000 each. Now the selling price is about Â£80,000. Mr. Whitley holds a sale of cattle and sheep in the Autumn on his land at Halsanger.He owns the largest amount of land in the area.It stretches from Welstor to Ilsington.
